English (United States)(en-US): Hello, <nickname>….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, <nickname>….

English (United States)(en-US): (Calmly question.)|(Gently worry.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (차분하게 물어본다)|(다정하게 걱정한다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, did you go out today?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 오늘은 안 나갔어?

English (United States)(en-US): I couldn’t.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 못 나갔어.

English (United States)(en-US): Against my will, I failed, utterly and wholly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 나의 의지와는 무관하게,\n명백히, 온전히 실패했어.

English (United States)(en-US): According to the language\nsystem, I ‘couldn’t’ go out.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들의 언어 체계에 따르면\n나는 밖으로 나가지 ‘못’ 한 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Your eyes are missing, Dot…\nIs something wrong?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 눈이 왜 사라져\n있을까…. 무슨 일 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Wrong? Nothing so dramatic\nas to be called ‘wrong’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무슨 일이 있다? ‘무슨 일’이라\n불릴 만큼 대단한 일은 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): But ‘something’ is always happening.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러나 동시에 ‘어떠한 일’은\n항상 일어나고 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a saying.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 걱정의 표현이야.

English (United States)(en-US): People ask whether something’s\nwrong when they’re worried.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 걱정이 될 때 통상적으로\n‘무슨 일이 있냐’라고 표현하거든.

English (United States)(en-US): I see… ‘worried’ is a warm and loving state.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나…. ‘걱정’은 따뜻하고 애정 어린 것.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you, <nickname>.\nIt’s a small comfort.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고마워, <플레이어>. 미약하게나마 위안이 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, you’re worrying me. Is something\nheavy and unpleasant bothering you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야, 정말 걱정돼. 무겁고\n못된 고민이 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Well, it’s….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 으음….

English (United States)(en-US): It’s heavy alright. But not unpleasant.\nRather, I’m nursing over kind things.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무거운 것은 맞지. 그러나 못된 고민은 아니야.\n오히려 다정한 것들에 대한 고민이지.

English (United States)(en-US): Heavy but kind. And so it’s hard\nto simply soothe them away…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무겁지만 다정한. 그렇기에 마음\n놓고 어루만질 수 없는…

English (United States)(en-US): That’s what’s tying me to this corner.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 날 이 모퉁이에 묶어 두고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Why did the moon people save me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들은 날 왜 살린 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I can’t comprehend it no matter how\nhard I think. I can’t even begin to guess.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 아무리 고민해도 이해할\n수가 없어. 짐작도 가지를 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Why did they give me warmth and life?\nWhy send me to this beautiful planet?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 나에게 따스한 온기와 생명의 기회를 준 걸까?\n왜 나를 이 아름답고 푸르른 행성으로 보낸 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): I was nothing but a blob of\nfilth, grimy and meaningless…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 분명 불결하고 무가치한\n오물 덩어리였을 뿐인데….

English (United States)(en-US): From what you’ve said… I guess your\nlast words struck something in them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 이야기를 들어 보면… 다들 너의\n마지막 말을 듣고 놀란 눈치였던 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): “Maybe someone out there wants\nme as a dream of their own.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “저 밖엔 나를 꿈으로 삼아 줄\n다른 존재가 있을지도 몰라요.”

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a hopeful message, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 말, 정말 긍정적이고 희망적인데?

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe the workers saw your unending optimism,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 직원들은 어쩌면 너의 밝은 사고 방식을 보고,

English (United States)(en-US): and thought, here’s someone that can\nseek hope even in the depth of despair!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 절망 속에서도 꿋꿋하게 ‘희망’을\n좇을 줄 아는 아이구나, 생각했을 수 있겠어!

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a valuable thing on Earth as well, you see.|It’s a difficult feat even for humans, you see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 지구에서도 멋진 일이거든.|그건 인간에게조차 어려운 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): But I never sought hope?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 나는 ‘희망’을 좇지 않았는걸?

English (United States)(en-US): No, no. it wasn’t hope I was gazing at.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 아니. 나는 희망 같은 걸 바라보고 있지 않았어.

English (United States)(en-US): At the time I was gazing into cold death and,\ncolder still, the darkness of the universe,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당시의 나는 차가운 죽음과 그보다\n차가울 우주의 암흑을 바라보며

English (United States)(en-US): turbulating fear in my throat,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 휘몰아치는 공포를 머금은 채

English (United States)(en-US): when my gaze happened to swim over onto\nsomething on the far corner of the universe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우주의 어느 먼 구석을 시선 끝으로\n헤엄치다 무언가를 맞닥뜨렸을 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Like a shining star?|Like a dying asteroid?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반짝이는 별 같은 것?|죽어 가는 운석 같은 것?

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing of the sort. It had no shape, no name.\nIt merely rippled in the rough, silent dark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 것들은 분명 아니었어. 그건 형체도, 이름도\n없었어. 거칠고 고요한 암흑 속에서 나풀거리기만 할 뿐.

English (United States)(en-US): And while gazing at it, I wondered.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것을 바라보다 보니, 문득\n궁금증이 일었을 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): If there really is no one that wants me as a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 꿈으로 삼아 줄 존재가 정말 없을지.

English (United States)(en-US): Isn’t that what one calls hope?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 희망을 느꼈다는 것 아니야?

English (United States)(en-US): No, no. It wasn’t like that. Nothing like that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니야, 아니야. 그런 것과는 달랐어. 분명 달랐어.

English (United States)(en-US): Something much more vague….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그보다는 훨씬 모호한 종류의 것이었는데….

English (United States)(en-US): (Silence.)|I wonder what it was….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (침묵한다.)|그러게, 뭐였을까….

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a mystery, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어려워. <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll ask for you later. Would\nyou mind coming over again?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠시 후에 부를게. 그때 이 모퉁이로 돌아와 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you for coming by again.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 돌아와 줘서 고마워.

English (United States)(en-US): I, was in pain while you were gone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나, 네가 없는 동안 고통스러운 시간을 보냈어.

English (United States)(en-US): I looked back, back, back on my past,\none of questions with no answers.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 답 없는 질문만 남긴 과거를\n돌아보고, 돌아보고, 돌아보다,

English (United States)(en-US): and lost precious hours of what\nmatters most, my time on Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나에게 가장 중요한 ‘지구에서의\n시간’을 수없이 잃어버렸어.

English (United States)(en-US): And yet why does my stupid self return\nto that day, every minute and second of it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 왜 나의 멍청한 머리는 그날의 기억으로\n매 분 매 초 되돌아가 머물기를 택하는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): I want to run forever from my past.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과거로부터 영원히 도망치고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): It grieves me to think that I’ll never recall\nRed, Edison, and Sir Cello ever again,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드, 에디슨, 그리고 첼로 경을 다시는\n떠올리지 못하게 될 거라는 사실은 슬프지만

English (United States)(en-US): but memories of the Moon are ones of despair.\nI’m reminded endlessly that I was born in the dark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에는 나를 비참하게 하는 기억들이 너무 많아. 내가\n암흑 속에서 태어났다는 사실을 수없이 상기당해야만 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): If I could rip out those nightmarish times…\nIf I could focus solely on my future on Earth…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 악몽 같던 시간을 통째로 도려 낼 수만 있다면…\n지구에서의 미래만 보며 살 길이 있다면….

English (United States)(en-US): I want to ask you something.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 묻고 싶은 게 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): … Do you have a past like that too?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 너에게도 그런 과거가 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Remnants from it that you can’t help but stew over.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 끈질기게 잘근잘근 곱씹게\n되는 과거의 파편들 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): No. But I have a vivid memory.|Yes. I don’t know how to be free of it just yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 없어. 하지만 유독 생생한 기억은 있지.|있어. 자유로워지는 법을 아직 모르겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): What memory?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 기억인데?

English (United States)(en-US): Well…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 기억이냐면…

English (United States)(en-US): Do you want to go back?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때로 돌아가고 싶어?

English (United States)(en-US): Not ever.|If only.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무슨 일이 있더라도 절대 돌아가지 않을 거야.|그때를 다시 살아갈 수만 있다면 참 행복할 텐데.

English (United States)(en-US): What was it like?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 기억인데?

English (United States)(en-US): Precious, but long since lost.|Dim and hunched, reeking of mold.|Like falling head first down a cliff.|I can’t even bring myself to describe it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너무 소중하지만, 다시는 돌아갈 수 없어.|곰팡내 풍기는 어둑하고 구부정한 기억이야.|낭떠러지 아래로 추락하는 것만 같은 시간이었어.|차마 묘사할 수조차 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): If my memory serves me…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기억을 되짚어 보자면…

English (United States)(en-US): Do you want to go back?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때로 돌아가고 싶어?

English (United States)(en-US): Not ever.|If only.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무슨 일이 있더라도 절대 돌아가지 않을 거야.|그때를 다시 살아갈 수만 있다면 참 행복할 텐데.

English (United States)(en-US): But that’s what the past is like, thankfully.\nNo matter what I want… I can’t ever go back.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 다행히 과거라는 게 그런 거잖아. 나의\n희망과는 무관하게… 결코 돌아갈 수 없는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): But that’s what the past is like, regrettably.\nNo matter what I want… I can’t ever go back.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 아쉽게도 과거라는 게 그런 거잖아. 나의\n희망과는 무관하게… 결코 돌아갈 수 없는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): I think the only choice I have is to live\non with those memories tucked in me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나에겐 그 기억을 가진 채 미래를\n살아가는 것만이 유일한 선택지인 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve heard your words and come to a decision.\nI will erase my memories from the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 말을 듣고 결심했어. 나,\n달에서의 기억을 지워 버릴래.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s the only way to stop me from losing anything.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래야 그 무엇도 잃지 않을 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): The only way for me to forget of my darkness\n and start a treasured, vibrant life on earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래야만 나의 암흑에 대한 기억을 잊고,\n지구에서 값지고 다채로운 시간을 시작할 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Calm down, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 진정해 봐, 뭉치.

English (United States)(en-US): I wouldn’t want you to throw your past away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 네가 너의 과거를 버리지 않았으면 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): The past is like a friend for life.|Recalling the past is a double-edged blade.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과거는 너의 영원한 친구 같은 거야.|과거를 떠올리는 행위에는 득과 실이 공존하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Is the Dot of today, the past, and the\nfuture all separate from each other?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과연 지금, 그리고 미래의 뭉치와\n과거의 뭉치를 떼어 낼 수 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): By giving away time now and mulling over what\nonce was, you may gain something more valuable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 현재의 시간을 내어 주고 과거를 반추하는\n동안, 너는 더 값진 것들을 얻게 될지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): Close your eyes for me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈을 감아 볼래?

English (United States)(en-US): Now picture the Moon. The dark side of it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 달을 떠올려 봐. 그 위성의 뒤편을.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s rough but beautiful, I see the factory,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 척박하지만 아름다워. 공장이 보이고,

English (United States)(en-US): and completed moon\nspheres being sent to Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 완성형의 꿈 구체들이 지구로 송출되고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): (Wondrous secrets of the Moon.)|(I still can’t quite wrap my head around it.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (환상적인 달의 비밀이었지.)|(아직 조금 믿기지 않지만.)

English (United States)(en-US): What else do you see? Down below?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또 뭐가 보여? 그 아래에는?

English (United States)(en-US): The guillotine of dreams, the eerie\nfan and the filth disposal site.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈들의 단두대, 그 섬뜩한\n파쇄 팬과 오물 처리장이 보여.

English (United States)(en-US): Those on the Moon scraping away\nmoon filth with sharp rakes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날카로운 갈퀴로 굳은 꿈 폐기물들을\n긁어 내는 달의 이들도.

English (United States)(en-US): Memories of the Moon…\nare like a nest made of thorns.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서의 기억은… 가시 깔린 보금자리야.

English (United States)(en-US): I want to throw myself into it, but\nthe embrace will be a sorry, sore one.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몸통을 폭삭 파묻고 안겨들고 싶지만,\n그건 따갑고 쓰라린 포옹일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Memories from then are dotted\nwith my… worthlessness,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때의 기억은 꿈 폐기물의 징그러운 악취와

English (United States)(en-US): of having been born from the stench of dream\nfilth and never having made it far away from it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그로부터 태어나 멀리 떨어지지 못한…\n나의 무가치함으로 점철되어 있으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Why did you feel that the Moon and its\ncold surface could be a nest to dive into?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 차디찬 달을 안겨들고 싶은 보금자리로\n느낄 수 있던 이유는 뭐야?

English (United States)(en-US): The beings on it were blindingly vivid. My\nfirst… friends. Something like… my family.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아득하게 선명한 그들.\n나의 첫… 친구들. 어쩌면… 가족.

English (United States)(en-US): You mean the moon cleaners you told me about.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 전에 이야기해 주었던 달 청소부들을 말하는 거구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. Sir Cello, stroking me and humming softly.\nAnd I see myself atop his belly, eyes closed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 부드러운 화음을 내며 날 쓰다듬던 첼로 경.\n그리고 그의 뱃살 위로 올라가 눈을 감던 내가 보여.

English (United States)(en-US): How soft it must have felt.|How beautiful it must have sounded.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얼마나 포근한 품이었을까?|얼마나 아름다운 선율이었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Edison with her eyes full of curiosity, and\nher probing voice layered with affection.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 호기심 어린 눈으로 나를 꿰뚫고, 방울방울 분석하던\n에디슨의 음성에는 분명한 애정이 담겨 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): And Red too, with a heart that blazes\nlike a bonfire yet flutters like a candle.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 불꽃처럼 뜨겁지만 촛불만큼\n부드러운 마음을 가진 레드도 함께야.

English (United States)(en-US): I melted in his presence, but his roaring laughter\nmade the stickiness feel like a welcome challenge.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드와 가까워지면 난 조금 녹았지만, 그의 호탕한 웃음은\n그 질척한 감각마저 기분 좋은 도전처럼 느껴지게 했지.

English (United States)(en-US): Wouldn’t it hurt… not being able\nto recall all those memories?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 모든 기억을 다시는 떠올리지\n못한다면… 마음 아프지 않겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모르겠어….

English (United States)(en-US): But, but if I ever saw them again… I would\ngrasp the opportunity again and again
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만, 하지만 그들을 다시 한 번 볼 수 있다면…\n그 찰나와 같은 기회를 하염없이 매만지며

English (United States)(en-US): and tell them how very thankful I am.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 아주 고맙단 말을 전할 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): The trio were your dearest friends and family,\nbut others remember them as passing shadows.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달 삼총사는 뭉치에게 소중한 친구이자 가족이었지만,\n누군가의 기억에서는 그저 스쳐 지나가는 그림자일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Us humans, we can’t even perceive them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리 인간은 인식조차 못 하는 외계의 존재들인걸.

English (United States)(en-US): You, Dot, are the only one on Earth to remember\nthem as the kind beautiful souls they are.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들을 따뜻하고 아름다운 영혼으로 기억해\n줄 지구의 존재는, 뭉치, 네가 유일한 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It would be sad, and terrible.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 생각만 해도 슬프고 끔찍해.

English (United States)(en-US): No longer hearing their sweet chatterings…|To transmit to them that you forgot them…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 더 이상 그들의 귀엽고 따스한 이야기를 전해 듣지 못한다면….|네가 그들을 잊었다는 걸 달 송신기에 띄워 보내야 한다면….

English (United States)(en-US): But do you have any idea what it’s like\nto long for those you can never return to?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 돌아갈 수 없는 공간의 이들을\n그리워하는 마음이 얼마나 절망적인지 알아?

English (United States)(en-US): And, and thinking of them reminds me\nof the disturbing source of my very being.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고, 그들을 생각할 때마다 내 존재의 근원에\n대한 징그러운 기억도 함께 떠오른단 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I just want to run away from memories of the\nMoon, and the dark aching pain they bring me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 달에서의 기억으로부터, 그 기억이 불러오는 시커멓고\n아릿한 통각으로부터 영영 도망치고 싶을 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): (Is there no way to convince Dot….)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치를 설득할 방법이 없을까….)

English (United States)(en-US): (Oh… there is one.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (아… 그거면 되겠어.)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, I think you’re right. I want\nto erase all my past memories too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야, 네 말이 맞는 것 같아. 나도\n나의 어두웠던 과거를 전부 다 지울래.

English (United States)(en-US): Could you do it for me, Dot? You come from the\nMoon, you must have the power to do so. Right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 기억도, 뭉치가 지워 주면 안 돼? 뭉치는 신비한\n달에서 왔으니까 내 기억도 지워 줄 수 있잖아. 그치?

English (United States)(en-US): Wait… huh?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어… 어?

English (United States)(en-US): Wait. What are you saying? Why would\nyou want to erase your past as well?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠시만. 무슨 소리야? 왜 너의\n과거까지 지우려고 하는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Turning over a new leaf doesn’t sound so bad!|I can’t stand myself whenever I remember.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 새로 시작하는 것도 나쁘지 않을 것 같아서!|떠올리려 할 때마다 내 자신이 미워지거든.

English (United States)(en-US): But you might start over with\na huge part of yourself missing…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 네 자신의 커다란 일부를\n잃어버린 채 시작해야 할지도 몰라….

English (United States)(en-US): Remembering the past is like tracing\na map, so as not to get lost in the future.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과거를 기억하는 일은 마치 지도를 읽어 나가는\n것과 같아서, 미래에서 길을 잃지 않도록 도와줘.

English (United States)(en-US): But it’s better to know where your troubles\ncome from, and why you loathe a part of yourself,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 원흉조차 모르는\n어려움을 품고 길을 잃는 것보다

English (United States)(en-US): rather than straying off the past laden\nwith troubles you don’t know the source of.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 어려움이 어디에서 왔고, 네가 왜 너의 일부를\n미워하게 되는지 명확하게 아는 편이 나아.

English (United States)(en-US): Events of the past are bound to\nleave their marks on the future.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과거의 사건들은 필연적으로\n미래에 흔적을 남기거든.

English (United States)(en-US): (There we go.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (성공이다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Such as?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 예를 들면?

English (United States)(en-US): Violent ones leave behind purpling bruises,\nlike sharp ones leave behind thin nicks of a blade.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 폭력적인 시간들은 검푸른 멍을, 날카로운\n순간들은 칼자국 같은 흉을 남겼을 수 있겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Like how the human born into a triangular family\nnursed a hole within from their pointy tips?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세모난 가족에게서 태어나 그들의 꼭지점에\n아파하던 인간 속에 텅 빈 구멍이 자라났던 것처럼?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, that’s it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 맞아.

English (United States)(en-US): Losing a loved one leaves behind a fear of love,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑했던 사람을 잃었던\n기억은 사랑에 대한 두려움을,

English (United States)(en-US): and a failed relationship leaves behind\na hesitancy for true commitment.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실패한 애착의 경험은 진실된 교류에\n대한 회피를 남겼을 수도 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): We look back on those pasts, and\ntrace the patterns left on me now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 그 과거를 돌아보며, 현재 나에\n새겨진 흔적들을 짐작해 볼 수 있는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): ’So this is where I come from,’\nor something like that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ’아, 그때의 내가 있었기에\n지금의 내가 이렇구나’ 하며?

English (United States)(en-US): … Right. Not looking back means we can’t\ntell what traces remain from that time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 맞아. 과거를 돌아보지 않을 경우, 나에게\n어떤 흔적이 남아 있는지를 알 수조차 없게 되지.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s only when we face them do we decide\nto leave them be, or hide them away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그걸 바라봐야 흔적을 인정하고 남겨 둘지,\n애써 덮어 볼지를 선택할 수 있는데 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): See. You already know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이것 봐. 뭉치도 잘 알고 있잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): I think you lose your level head when it\ncomes to your fear of the ‘blackness’ within.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 유독 너의 ‘검정’에 대한 두려움 앞에만\n서면 객관적인 시선을 잃는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh… well…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어어… 어…

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, your past on the Moon is what\nshapes your present here on Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 달에서의 과거는 지구에서의 현재를\n가장 잘 설명해 줄 수 있는 시간이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Because those memories left behind vivid things.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그떄의 기억은 너에게 분명한 것들을 남겼으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): First, memories of the moon trio. Ones\nyou can gaze into and smile at every day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우선, 달 삼총사에 대한 기억을 선물해 줬지.\n매일 들여다보며 미소 지을 수 있는 순간을.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m positive recalling those instances of having\nbeen loved and trusted will tie you to the world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 애정과 믿음을 받아 본 경험은 너를\n세상에 묶어 주는 끈이 될 거라 확신해.

English (United States)(en-US): And above all… you’ll know where that darkness\nyou loathe so comes from, and why it pains you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇보다… 네가 증오하는 너의 암흑이 어디에서 왔고,\n너를 왜 고통스럽게 하는지 알 수 있게 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Those writhing memories painted black will become\nyour most powerful motive.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 우글거리는 검정의 기억은 너의 강력한 동력이\n되어 줄 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Like a strong wind.|Like fertile nutrients.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 힘찬 바람처럼 말이야.|비옥한 거름처럼 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): … and I’ll go far far away, and\nbecome a colorful dream of yours.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 난 그로부터 멀리 멀리 떨어져서,\n너의 다채로운 꿈이 되고야 말 테니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know how not to abuse\nmy past. It still feels awkward, but….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 과거를 가혹하게 채찍질하지\n않는 법을 모르겠어. 아직 어색하지만….

English (United States)(en-US): But do I dare?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 되는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Do I dare to gaze ahead while burdened\nby the weight of my past?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 묵직한 과거와 동행하면서도\n감히 앞을 바라볼 수 있는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Of course. We’re all layers of our past.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 우리 모두 과거가 차곡히 쌓여 모인 존재인걸.

English (United States)(en-US): And so am I.|(Hesitate, and fall silent.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 마찬가지고.|(머뭇거리다 침묵한다.)

English (United States)(en-US): …. It takes courage not to forget.\nBut I’ve made up my mind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …. 잊지 않는 것에도 용기가\n필요하구나. 하지만 결심이 들어.

English (United States)(en-US): I see now, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제야 알겠어, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll look back, beyond the atmosphere, and never\nforget. The trio—my first friends and family,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 몇 번이고 대기 너머를 뒤돌아보며 잊지 않을래.\n나의 첫 친구이자 가족이었던 달 삼총사,

English (United States)(en-US): the dry white land, the harsh attacks surrounding\nme, the terrifying blackness of the dream filth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 백색의 건조한 토지, 날 둘러싼 이들의 맹렬한\n비난, 공포스럽던 공장 폐기물의 검정까지도.

English (United States)(en-US): Those memories will stay by\nmy side. And repeat, and return.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 모든 기억은 나의 곁에 오래 남아\n있겠지. 되풀이되고 되돌아오며.

English (United States)(en-US): Like the remains of a bonfire,\nor the scar of a burn mark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 때로는 모닥불의 잔열처럼, 때로는 화상의 흉터처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): But no matter how much I struggle\nwith my past, we don’t have to forget it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 과거와 공생하는 게 아무리 어려울지라도,\n우리는 그를 잊으려 애쓸 필요가 없는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Because those layers lead to who we are now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 차곡차곡 쌓인 과거는 결국\n우리의 현재로 흐르는 것이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): It won’t be easy on my heart when past\npains stab me, but I’ll have you as a friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과거의 고통이 날 찔러대는 날이면 유독 마음이\n어렵겠지만, 나에겐 너라는 친구가 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, it won’t be as hard now that you’re not alone.\nDo you think you can be free now, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 혼자일 때보다 수월할 거야.\n그러니 뭉치, 이제 자유로워질 수 있지?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I think I’m freer. And look.\nThe color of my heart… oh…!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 이제 조금은 자유로워진 것 같아.\n이것 봐. 심장 색도… 어…!

English (United States)(en-US): Gray like the moon. It’s pretty.|I think the moon inside of you is thanking you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달을 닮은 회빛이네. 예쁘다.|네 마음속 달이 고마워하고 있나 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re right. Gray like a warm shadow.\nThe color of my birthplace, my corner.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게. 따뜻하고 고마운 그림자의 색.\n나의 시초지와, 나의 모퉁이를 닮은.

English (United States)(en-US): Now I’d like to gaze at the sky and miss this\nshade of gray. Thank you for our talk, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 하늘을 바라보며 이 회색빛을 마음껏\n그리워해 보고 싶어. 이야기 나눠 주어 고마웠어, <nickname>.
